I recommend Al Gore’s talk "Averting the climate crisis" (Talk ID 1). The talk’s description says he “spells out 15 ways that individuals can address climate change immediately, from buying a hybrid to inventing a new, hotter brand name for global warming.” The transcript excerpts reinforce this practical focus: he explicitly tells people to “buy a hybrid. Use light rail,” to “be a green consumer,” and to “make a decision to live a carbon-neutral life” (including using a carbon calculator and purchasing offsets). 

Talk details: 
- Speaker: Al Gore 
- Title: Averting the climate crisis 
- URL: https://www.ted.com/talks/al_gore_averting_the_climate_crisis/ 

These lines from the talk and its description show it directly addresses everyday actions individuals can take.
